title: (x) Fear Factory "Transgression" - Transfer {Yves}
content:
Can anyone ID this font? They used it all over the packaging so I know it’s for real. Please let me know.

Thanks,  
Kojo

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ff\_trans\_logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=ff_trans_logo.jpg) | 196.06 KB |
author: planetkojo

comments.content:
Almost.

The “C” and “S” look really close but the “Y” is quite a bit different.

Any other guesses?

ThanX,  
Kojo

You guys came really really close. :-) This is another [Rodrigo Xavier Cavazos](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Rodrigo%20Xavier%20Cavazos) colaboration, also available from [Psy/Ops](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Psy/Ops) — not with Sophisto’s [Stefan Hattenbach](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Stefan%20Hattenbach) but with [Julien Janiszewski](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Julien%20Janiszewski) — [Target](http://web.archive.org/web/20051128095035/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_transfer_ss.html).

A little Belgian lesson, taught.

hhp
Ouch, am I sounding like a smartass again? ;^P

Are you smart? Do you have an ay-ess-ess? Well then.  
I’m a big subscriber to the “if you’ve got it, flaunt it” school of thought.

hhp

Cool guys! Thanks for all your help. Yes, we had the right company, wrong font. I actually contacted the designer, Tom Jermann, directly. And he filled me in. Great guy, awesome design work. Check them out at t42design.com

Anyways, thanks again everyone.  
Kojo
